profileAlternative.name: Dorothy McClelland
profileAlternative.headline: Cloud Events Manager at MongoDB
profileAlternative.summary:
Skills: excellent written and verbal communication, highly organized, self-directed and self-motivated, ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously while working autonomously or as part of a group, close attention to detail, strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills, experience in training, mentoring, and managing individuals and teams.

Applications: Fluent in Mac and PC, type 93 wpm, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Microsoft Office Suite, Google Docs, Google AdWords, basic Salesforce, FileMaker Pro, Constant Contact, Survey Monkey, and basic HTML.

Presentations:
Co-organizer and Co-presenter of "Intentional Language: How We Describe Museum Education Can Make All the Difference"​ - National Art Education Association Conference, March 2013
Organizer and Moderator of "Museums and Education: Who's Afraid of the Common Core" - California Association of Museums Conference, February 2013

positions.title: MongoDB
positions.description: MongoDB, Inc. is the company behind MongoDB. We build MongoDB and the drivers, and sell software and services to make your life easier. We also run MongoDB University and sponsor the community, hosting MongoDB World and MongoDB events all over the globe. With offices across North America, Europe, and Asia, we are close to where you do business.

positions.title:
Title
Community Events Specialist
positions.description: MongoDB, Inc. is the company behind MongoDB. We build MongoDB and the drivers, and sell software and services to make your life easier. We also run MongoDB University and sponsor the community, hosting MongoDB World and MongoDB events all over the globe. With offices across North America, Europe, and Asia, we are close to where you do business.

positions.title: ZERO1: The Art & Technology Network
positions.description:
Audience Development
• Work with the Curator and Director of Programs and the Marketing Manager to identify strategies for broadening and deepening ZERO1’s audience base within the city of San Jose
• Identify and foster relationships with relevant individuals, community organizations, companies, and cultural institutions to encourage participation in ZERO1 programming
• Formulate and administer assessment plans to answer strategic questions about audience interests, learning, and attitudes as well as demographics

Program Development
• Help plan and oversee annual programs for the ZERO1 Garage, seeing programs from the inception and planning stages through to the implementation and evaluation
• Collaborate with colleagues in curatorial and marketing to formulate, promote, and assess community programs that reach ZERO1’s target audiences

Additional Roles
• Assist with the preparation, coordination, and installation of all exhibitions
• Proofread and edit all print and digital marketing materials
• Manage day-to-day office and gallery operations
• Coordinate meeting schedule for Executive Director, frequently serving as institutional liaison with the public
• Continued role as Event Coordinator
…
see more

positions.title:
Title
Event Coordinator
positions.description:
• Increased event rentals 30% by expanding marketing initiatives and visibility surrounding events.
• Prepare contracts and schedule bookings of event space.
• Gather all information on each rental to achieve quality event productions.
• Answer and process all guest requests for special events.
• Coordinate appointments and visits to see the Garage, and scheduling of events on the calendar.
• Serve as liaison with vendors on event-related matters, when needed.
• Assist with managing on-site production and clean up for events, as necessary.
• Close out all events as required.
• Keep track of event finances including check requests, invoicing, and reporting.
• Promote event rentals.
• Propose new ideas to improve the event planning and implementation process.
…
see more

positions.title:
Title
Gallery Assistant
positions.description:
• Greet gallery visitors and make exhibitions on view legible and interesting to a variety of audiences.
• Collect research on exhibiting artists for use by gallery staff.
• Assist at public programs and private events, frequently serving as the staff representative.
• Maintain welcoming and hospitable gallery space and upkeep of the exhibition.

positions.title: Contributing Editor
positions.description: • Proofread, fact check, and edit art, film, and fashion articles by international writers for monthly online publication.

positions.title: Orange County Museum of Art
positions.description:
• Assist in the selection and supervision of 10-12 education interns per year. Train education interns in inquiry-based gallery teaching, working with a variety of audiences, museum practices, and education philosophy. Mentor interns daily on studio and gallery teaching.
• Schedule and provide administration for all School and Public Tours, as well as the follow-up records, statistics and evaluations.
• Serve as the primary point of contact with teachers, tour organizers, and internship applicants.
• Provide key administrative support for OCMA’s education and public programs.
• Develop and teach hands-on art activities that support and extend the ideas of the current exhibition while aligning with Common Core standards and 21st century skills such as problem-solving, thinking creatively, and trial-and-error. Teach this lesson on a daily basis to thousands of local elementary school students.
• Oversee Studio budget and day-to-day operations, such as ordering and maintaining studio supplies.
• Revamped intern training program to better align with the philosophy of the Education Department and current museum education practices.
• Expanded the Education Internship to a year-long experience. This was done to reduce staff time spent training interns and create a more meaningful internship experience.
• Revised intern manual to better reflect the expectations and responsibilities of the Education Internship.
…
see more

• Served as primary point of contact with teachers and adult tour organizers.
• Provided key administrative support for OCMA’s education and public programs.
• Assist in the selection and supervision of education interns per year. Train education interns in inquiry-based gallery teaching, working with a variety of audiences, museum practices, and education philosophy.

positions.title:
Title
Education Intern
positions.description:
• Provide interactive inquiry-based school and public tours, assist with teaching hands-on art projects as well as engage the community through a variety of school, family and public programs
• Assist in the marketing, research, planning and implementation of education programs.
• Assist with the coordination of monthly Free Second Sunday public programs by helping design and edit materials, send out monthly marketing email, distribute fliers to libraries, perform Family Tour and assist with the organization of volunteers.
• Experience teaching in the galleries with a variety of ages, working with different audiences, engaging the public, and executing a variety of touring techniques.
…

positions.description:
• Provide day-to-day leadership for the Campus Tours program overseeing 70 Representatives.
• Assist in the planning and implementation of special programs such as Explore UCI, Celebrate UCI, and Honor’s Experience Day.
• Organize multiple events and work within a limited budget.
• Plan and perform the Campus Representative recruitment, interview, selection and training process.

given.text: Dorothy was the most effective and most creative Studio Program organizer and "implementer" of the Studio Program when at the Orange County Museum of Art. Good luck, Dorothy in your new position!!
